description.narrative:
Goal: The ultimate goal of the research project is to improve the understanding of local authorities and local communities (men, women, boys and girls) of the changes in sediment loads and contents, as well as the impacts from the changes on the agriculture and livelihoods, hence they could take actions to adapt to and become more resilient to the sedimentation changes.
Objective: The research project comprises of three main objectives which will be accomplished by June 2017. - Objective 1: Local authorities and local communities (men, women, boys and girls) understand the main causes and factors contributing to the reduction of sediment in the Mekong Delta of Vietnam in the past 20 years and trends in the future as well, hence will be able to develop local plans and strategies to address the problems.
- Objective 2: Community based water management initiatives led by local people, especially women groups and farmer associations in agricultural and fishery sectors are demonstrated to respond to the reduction of sediment and water shortage in the Mekong Delta region of Vietnam.
- Objective 3: Collaboration and communication amongst key stakeholders in water governance and management, including local governments, local communities, CSOs and networks are improved, as well as local communities are strongly engaged in the policy making processes in the water governance and management sector in the Mekong Delta of Vietnam.

participating-org.narrative: 2. Functions and tasks 2.1 Functions: CEWAREC is an independent consulting unit who carries out research and provides scientific and technological services and international cooperation in fields of planning, management and sustainable development of water resources and related resources, environment protection and adaption to climate change. 2.2 Tasks: - Scientific research and technology development in the fields of water and related resources, environment and adaptation to climate change. - Provision of consultations in evaluation and appraisal for projects, environmental strategy impact assessment and as well as project EIA. - Provision of Services relating to human resources capacity building in the fields of water resources, environment and climate change. 2.3 Scope of Works: - Implementation of studies relating to sustainable and integrated management and development of water resources, environment impacts, environment strategies and environment impact assessment of investmentprojects and adaptation to climate change. -Management of natural disaster risks and community based natural disaster risk management. - Implementation of verification and criticism of water resource development and planning projects. - Implementationof surveys and consulting services relating to solutionsto sustainable development and management of natural disaster risks and adaptations to climate change. - Advise in sustainable development and integrated management of national and internationalriver basins. - Provide with services of capacity building and public awareness in sustainable development and integrated management of water and related resources, and adaptation of climate change. -Cooperate with international partners in the implementation of related activities, programs and projects relating to the above mentioned scientific and technological fields.
CENTRE FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT WATER RESOURCES & CLIMATE CHANGE AD
